page.title: 17Farming
page.content: Most of the land is tough{grazing {land},but some is ploughed to grow barley to feed the animals in winter. {Mixed farming}This is a mixture of cattle and sheep.The numbers vary because the farmers might get more sheep than cows or vice versa.Some mixed farms may have young bullocks and sell them fat.Some farmers make silage for cows in winter and a little hay for calves.The silage is made into large round bales.{Dairy cows }Out of 7 farms marked on our map 3 do dairy cattle and 1 has a milk round.{Beef {cattle }Some cattle are kept only to breed calves to sell for beef. {Sheep. The most popular breeds are Swaledale and Herdwick.The lambs are weaned in October.The ewes are tupped about December and January.
